FuncDef:
The dhcp-server giaddr command configures the GiAddr address of packets sent by a DHCPv4 server group.
The undo dhcp-server giaddr command restores the default setting.
By default, the GiAddr address of packets sent by a DHCPv4 server group is a gateway address.

ParaDef.Info:
Specifies the number of the interface.
-

Specifies the type of the interface.
-

Specifies the name of the interface.
-

ExtraInfo:
Usage Scenario
Through the dhcp-server giaddr command changes the GiAddr address of packets sent by a DHCPv4 server group.
Precautions
In VS mode, this command is supported only by the admin VS.
The GiAddr address specified by ip-addr cannot conflict with any user IP address.
